Module com.fy916.bubblebobble
Package com.fy916.bubblebobble.controllers.renderer

Class GamePageImageLoader

java.lang.Object
com.fy916.bubblebobble.controllers.renderer.GamePageImageLoader
public class GamePageImageLoader extends Object
A class combined with multiple methods to facilitate the usage of the GameController
. Demonstrates the FACADE Design Pattern.
Author:
fy916

  • Method Details

    • render_all_lives

      public static void render_all_lives​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives1, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives2, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives3, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives4, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives5, int remaining, int total)
      Render the total lives player will have at the top of the window, according to different gaming difficulties.
      Parameters:
      lives1 - Image Placeholder for the first life rendered on the screen
      lives2 - Image Placeholder for the second life rendered on the screen
      lives3 - Image Placeholder for the third life rendered on the screen
      lives4 - Image Placeholder for the forth life rendered on the screen
      lives5 - Image Placeholder for the fifth life rendered on the screen
      remaining - The count of the remaning lives
      total - The count of the total lives

    • render_lives

      public static void render_lives​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives1, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives2, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives3, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives4, javafx.scene.image.ImageView lives5, int remaining)
      Render the lives according to the left of the lives player has
      Parameters:
      lives1 - to
      lives5 - Image Placeholder for the first to the fifth life rendered on the screen
      remaining - The count of the remaning lives

    • renderLives

      public static void renderLives​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView livePlaceholders, boolean is_alive)
      Render the life placeholder according to the boolean type
      Parameters:
      livePlaceholders - Image Placeholder to be rendered
      is_alive - Mark if the image is to be filled as alive picture

    • updateUIIndicators

      public static void updateUIIndicators​(InteractableWorld world, javafx.scene.control.ProgressIndicator Hero_time_indicator_red, javafx.scene.control.ProgressIndicator Hero_time_indicator_green, javafx.scene.control.ProgressBar Hero_Ability_Indicator, javafx.scene.control.ProgressBar Boss_health_indicator)
      Update the indicators for the game, which is fixed at the top of the Hero and Enemy
      Parameters:
      world - Current game world, used to provide the coordinates of the indicators
      Hero_time_indicator_green - The indicator for the hero shielding time
      Hero_time_indicator_red - The indicator for the hero stunning time
      Boss_health_indicator - The indicator for the health of the boss
      Hero_Ability_Indicator - The indicator for the charging time of the hero

    • updateHeroProgressRedIndicator

      public static void updateHeroProgressRedIndicator​(javafx.scene.control.ProgressIndicator indicator, int x, int y, double percentage, boolean display)
      Fill the hero stunning time indicator
      Parameters:
      indicator - The indicator to be rendered
      x - x coordinate of the hero
      y - y coordinate of the hero
      percentage - The filling percentage
      display - Whether to show the indicator

    • updateHeroProgressGreenIndicator

      Parameters:

      x - x coordinate of the hero

      display - Whether to show the indicator

    • setLayout

      public static void setLayout​(javafx.scene.control.Control indicator, int xLayout, int yLayout, double percentage, boolean display)
      Fill indicator according to the params
      Parameters:
      indicator - The indicator to be rendered
      xLayout - Calcuated X of the indicator
      yLayout - Calcuated Y of the indicator
      display - Whether to show the indicator
      percentage - Filling percentage
